title: Which one is correct? Recommend or recommended? - Quora

response.answer_text: The use depends on your subject. Users (a bunch of users) recommend this software. (the users came together to make a choice.) A user recommended this software. (because it’s one user, and he or she said the software is worthy) Subject and verbs should agree in English sentences. The tense of a verb is directly tied to the subject.

“Recommend” is a verb. I recommend that you study at a desk. “recommended” is the past form of the verb. John recommended that you study at a desk.” Use as a past participle: “This book was recommended to me by the professor.” “The professor has already recommended this book.”
